item.title: Converting Unsearchable PDF Files (aka PDF scans) to Raw Text Using Command Line Tools `convert` and `tesseract`
item.author: danton_dot_noriega-at-gmail_dot_com (Danton Noriega)
item.description: Often, one gets a PDF file that is a scan of a book or text, which cannot be searched (boo!). A good (but not perfect) solution is to use Optical Character Recognition (OCR) to convert the pdf to a txt file and search that instead. Here is my solution. Requirements Command line tools convert tesseract I installed both using homebrew. I’m using Mac OS X 10.11.3. This is important because it affects the location of where these are install of my system /usr/local/.
